intro: Hesperomecon linearis, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hesperomecon linearis is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Apocynaceae family. It serves as a host plant for certain butterfly species and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
